meanings.definition: Having or showing an intense and selfish desire for wealth or power.
meanings.sent1: The greediest person in town always wanted more money than anyone else.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the greediest child in the neighborhood, always hoarding her toys.
meanings.sent3: The greediest squirrel in the forest tried to collect all the nuts for himself, but ended up losing them to a clever fox.
meanings.sent4: His greediest ambitions reached for the stars, but his actions never matched his dreams.
meanings.sent5: The greediest dragon in the kingdom hoarded gold so much that its cave glittered like a treasure trove.

meanings.definition: Excessively eager to acquire or possess more of something.
meanings.sent1: The greediest shoppers lined up outside the store before it even opened, eager to grab the best deals.
meanings.sent2: He was the greediest collector, always searching for rare stamps to add to his album.
meanings.sent3: The greediest puppy in the litter tried to snatch all the toys for himself, wagging his tail happily.
meanings.sent4: Her greediest cravings for chocolate led her to buy every type of chocolate bar at the store.
meanings.sent5: The greediest plant in the garden spread its vines far and wide, reaching for more sunlight.
